perturbation.original_text: Talent represents and warrants that he has not granted nor will he grant to any other party any right, permission, or license to use the Property in connection with the advertisement, sale, or promotion of the Product or in connection with products that are identical or substantially similar to the Product.
perturbation.changed_text: Talent confirms that they have not granted nor will they grant to any other party any right, permission, or license to use the Likeness in connection with the advertisement, sale, or promotion of the Offering or in connection with offerings that are identical or substantially similar to the Offering.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'Property' and 'Likeness,' as well as 'Product' and 'Offering,' are used interchangeably, creating ambiguity about the scope of Talent's exclusive endorsement rights. The original text refers to property and product while the modified text refers to likeness and offering. Are these the same or different?

perturbation.original_text:
In consideration for the licenses granted hereunder, Company agrees to pay to CSA as follows:

a. A  [***]in the amount of [***]of Company’s revenues from sales of the Property Training  Course and all Products after
deductions for VAT, returns, refunds
perturbation.changed_text:
In consideration for the licenses granted hereunder, Company agrees to pay to CSA as follows:

a. A  [***]in the amount of [***]of Company’s receipts from sales of the Endorsement Program and all Deliverables after deductions for VAT, returns, refunds
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'revenues' and 'receipts' are used interchangeably, creating ambiguity about the basis for calculating royalties. Furthermore, 'Property Training Course' and 'Products' are replaced by 'Endorsement Program' and 'Deliverables' respectively. The new terms are not defined so it is ambiguous if they have the same coverage of the old terms.

perturbation.original_text: Talent shall have the right of approval in respect of all Product being proposed as any part of the Property appearing or integrated into it and all proposed use of the Property (including to whom the Property is distributed for sale if other than the general public) prior to public release and distribution.
perturbation.changed_text: Talent shall have the right of consent in respect of all Deliverables being proposed as any part of the Likeness appearing or integrated into it and all proposed use of the Likeness (including to whom the Items is distributed for sale if other than the general public) prior to public release and distribution.
perturbation.explanation: The terms 'approval' is changed to 'consent', the term 'Product' is replaced by 'Deliverables', and the term 'Property' is replaced by 'Likeness', also 'Property' is replaced by 'Items'. It is unclear if these replacements carry the same meaning, leading to a debate about the degree of freedom the talent has on the sale of the offering and the content it contains.
